text:
Testing the Equality of the Variances of Two Normally Distributed
Populations, Based on Two Independent Random Samples
The hypotheses concerned with the equality of the variances of two populations are
tested with an F-distributed test statistic. Hypothesis testing using a test statistic that
follows an F-distribution is referred to as the F-test. The F-test is used under the
assumption that the populations from which samples are drawn are normally distributed
and that the samples are independent.
